translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses🔽The Chapter with Khattiyas
The Elder Nun Pesalā’s Verses
“In this auspicious aeon,
the kinsman of Brahmā, of great fame,🔽the best of speakers, arose,
known by the clan name of Kassapa.
In the excellent city of Sāvatthī,
in the family of a lay follower,🔽I was a female animal. I saw that excellent Victor
and heard his teaching.
Going for refuge to that hero,
I undertook the precepts.
Sometimes that great hero,
in a gathering of the great people,🔽The best of men revealed
his own enlightenment,
in the previously unheard teachings,
and in suffering and so on.
The eye, knowledge, and wisdom,
and the light of knowledge arose for me.
Having heard that and learned it,
I asked the monks questions.
By that well-done deed,
and by my intention and aspiration,
having abandoned the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
And in my last birth,
I was born into a great merchant family.
Approaching the Buddha and the true Dhamma,
having heard the truth,
I went forth not long after,
I reflected on the meaning of the Truths;
Having destroyed all the pollutants,
I attained Liberation.
I have mastery in the psychic powers,
and in the divine ear element;
I have mastery in the knowledge of the minds of others,
Great Sage.
I know my manifold past lives,
and the divine eye is purified;
All pollutants are destroyed,
there is no more of this mundane state.
In the meaning, the Dhamma, the phrasing,
and in ready speech as well;
My knowledge is pure and clear,
through the power of the best of the Awakened Ones.
My pollutants are destroyed,
all my existences are uprooted;
Like an elephant with its fetters cut,
I live without pollutants.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations as well;
The six direct knowledges have been realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the nun Pesalā spoke these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ pesalā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Pesalātheriyāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam pesalā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽pesala atheriyā apadānam dasama
translated: The Story of the Elder Nun Pesalā is the tenth.
The Chapter on Khattiyas is finished.
The chapter with Khattiya as the first section is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Khattiyā brāhmaṇī ceva,🔽tathā uppaladāyikā;🔽Siṅgālamātā sukkā ca,
analyzed: khattiyā brāhmaṇī ca iva  tathā uppaladāyikā  siṅgālamātā sukkā ca
translated: Khattiya, and also Brahmin,🔽and the one who gave the lotus flower;🔽Siṅgālaka’s mother, and the barren woman,
and the one who was beautiful, and the one with half a robe.
Puṇṇā, and Ambapālī,
and the one who was good—these are the ten;
There are two hundred verses here,
forty-two less than forty-four.
Now the summary of the chapter:
Sumedhā, the one-day observance,
Kuṇḍalakesā, and the Khattiya;
A thousand, three hundred verses,
summarized as seventy-seven.
Together with the verses of the summary,
counted by the wise,
a thousand, three hundred verses,

analyzed: satta paññāsam eva ca ati  therikā apadānam samatta
translated: and seven times fifty-five.🔽The Theris’ Verses are finished.
The Collection of Long Discourses is finished.
